prompt.clinicalNote:
Clinical Note:

Patient presents with complaints of chronic pelvic pain. Pain has been present for the past 6 months and is described as sharp and stabbing, located in the lower abdomen. Pain is exacerbated by physical activity and relieved by rest. Patient reports no history of trauma or recent surgeries. Physical exam reveals tenderness upon palpation of the lower abdomen. Pelvic ultrasound was performed and showed no abnormalities. Patient has been prescribed ibuprofen for pain management.

*Patient presents with complaints of chronic pelvic pain for the past 6 months. Pain is described as sharp and stabbing, located in the lower abdomen. Pain is exacerbated by physical activity and relieved by rest. Patient denies any history of trauma or recent surgeries. Physical exam reveals tenderness upon palpation of the lower abdomen. Pelvic ultrasound was performed and showed no abnormalities. Patient has been prescribed ibuprofen for pain management.* 

Suggestions for improvement:
- Include any relevant medical history or previous treatments the patient has tried for their chronic pelvic pain.
- Specify the dosage and frequency of ibuprofen prescribed for pain management.
- Consider referring the patient to a specialist for further evaluation and management of chronic pelvic pain if symptoms persist despite initial treatment.
guidelines: GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain - PDF | Algo | Apply
